Message.Title: $150 billion company
Message.Msg: With a forward PE of 110. This market is so nuts it is not even funny. A company with this kind of market cap should have max forward PE of 40, AMZN should be producing $8 EPS, to have this kind of market cap, but it will never achieve those numbers with this business plan. Still short but it is painful I have to admit, eventually the price will match earnings, and earnings is not materializing here.

Topic.Title: $150 billion company

Message.Msg: According to Nasdaq, the Forward P/E(1y) 353.69. Nasdaq seems to still use the next four quaters, instead of the next calendar year which is another non apples-to-apples scam of the financial community. Regardless, Forward PE are BS, especially when a company has systematically missed for 4 years. Trailing PE is N/A. Cash position has dwindled rapidly despite the massive build in gift cards and Prime pre-paid (shipping and video content).

Message.Msg: As I wrote to my brother yesterday, there is much more at stake than AMZN with Twitter soon to go public. The only thing AMZN has going for it is that it is an internet darling of Wall St., and they protect at such. A Twitter IPO would not look as good if AMZN were allowed true price discovery, where it should be around $50 - $60 a share, not $300. When there is a lot of money to be made on IPO, you have to expect they are going to protect there interests. They can do what they want until judgment day, that is, earnings. But if the earnings aren't good, I don't see how the stock holds. Until then, I'm out and, instead, long puts on the TLT.

Cash position has been destroyed from massive malinvestment (no net cash... without the $3B raise the working capital ponzi would be clear to all) and low-margin, higher fixed cost infrstructure isn't helpful as the consumer further weakens. There are plenty of companies that are close to fairly valued. As I said long ago, INTC is trading at about 6X EV to EBITDA. INTC will fare well when the required systematic adjustments take place. I'm not looking for the market to tank. I want balance restored so that stocks are valued on fundamentals (earnings, growth, etc) rather than float manipulation and skimming... When that happens, some of the most shorted LCT stocks will increase and all these momentum scams will get crushed.

Message.Title: Amazon ex Chief Financil Office dies in an accident
Message.Msg: Joy Covey, 50, a pioneering tech executive, was killed Wednesday when her bicycle collided with a delivery van in a remote stretch of Silicon Valley. sigh

Topic.Title: Amazon ex Chief Financil Office dies in an accident

Message.Msg: Typo in the Topic line: Amazon ex Chief Financial Officer dies in an accident yesterday. It's sad, she was still young and rich, leaving a son behind.

Topic.Title: Amazon ex Chief Financil Office dies in an accident

Message.Msg: In 1999, Fortune magazine named Covey on a list of the 50 most powerful women. “As CFO, her feat was convincing Wall Street that a profitless company was worth $22 billion,” the magazine wrote. Things haven't changed much! http://www.bloomberg.com/news/2013-09-19/joy-covey-amazon-cfo-during-ipo-dies-in-bicycling-crash-at-50.html
